page.title: 12WALWORTH CASTLE.
page.content: The castle is situated in the north east corner of the village. It was built in 1189 by the Lord of Raby. The castle is built of Magnesian Limestone. It originally had four towers enclosing a central quadrangle. During the war the{Durham Light {Infantry}used the castle as an Officers'Mess and H.Q. The men lived in billets in the grounds, as did prisoners of war later. Durham County Council bought the castle after the war, and used it as an approved school for girls. In 1981 the castle was purchased by the present owners. The castle is now used as a hotel and restaurant. The castle is also used as{time share holiday accommodation. A family can purchase the use of a suite or room for a certain week every year for ten years.
